title: Picture-in-picture glitches out graphics
content:
This glitch randomly started happening this evening, and I'm not sure what's causing it?

What basically would happen is I would click the PIP button, and once I do that, fonts disappear (either certain letters would disappear, or they'd all turn into this weird blocky one), the toolbar flickers and changes color, and buttons also flicker. These graphical errors are confined to the window the video the PIP was playing, and stop once the window is closed.

I haven't seen graphical errors anywhere else on my system, so I don't think that's the problem. I haven't installed any new extensions in a while. So... yeah, a bit confused.
creator: corruptlully

title: create a login
content: My passwords page doesn't display or provide an access link to manually "create a login". Why not and what can I do to manually create a login?
creator: soundmeister

title: Print dialog - It aint broke, so don't fix it. Bring back option for the default to system print dialog
content:
Please bring back the option to let the system print dialog be the default. There's no need to fix what's not broken. I dislike the new FireFox dialog. I like and am used to the system print dialog, it works, does what I want, and it should be brought back for consistency with other applications.

I could previously fix this in about:config, but that option is now ignored.

I understand the desire to try something new, but it makes no sense to improve on what already works. And, to remove the about:config option means your imposing your will on me. FireFox never felt like an imposition before, this is like something I'd expect from Apple, not Mozilla.

Please bring back my choice and make it an easy configuration checkbox, no about:config voodoo.

Thanks!
creator: DavidOrDave

title: Default Amazon Search Thinks I'm in Canada
content: I was using a VPN set to Canada a little ways back, and now Firefox seems to believe I'm forever in Canada. Any time I go to use the default Amazon search included with the browser now, it defaults to Amazon.ca rather than Amazon.com. I've tried going to Amazon.com directly and manually adding the search, but that just gives me an error message. I don't have anything set to Canada at all anymore. How do I get my Amazon search to go back to normal? Is there something on the back-end I can edit to fix it?
creator: gvmanx

title: pull down menus/auto resizing
content: Hello, Just recently the pull down menus on all sites including this page here, do not work. If I click the arrow the menu pops up & immediately disappears. I cannot choose any of the things listed in the menu. I have to try a 1st letter or number to see if that matches any of the items on the menu. Also, every time I use the CTRL button, the screen resizes! Every copy & paste makes the screen get larger, and I have to manually size back down to normal. I have tried the Firefox refresh, and it made no difference. Is there an update I can take off, or a new one that will fix these issues? Thank you Christine
creator: a996ontrak

title: Prevent web browser opening when connection goes offline
content:
Hi

I guess this applies for any web browser, but is there an option to disable this with Firefox...? Basically, whenever my BT connection goes offline, Firefox decides to take it upon itself to open up just to tell me it can't connect/that the web is offline etc. It's seriously annoying. I know it's offline as the hub light will change from blue to green/orange etc. It's even worse if I'm doing something else, such as playing on a game, and it's interrupted by the web browser opening itself.Â :-\

Any suggestions? Thanks.
creator: DustyShinigami
